document.masterDocTitle: Description of the larvae of three species of Laccophilus Leach and comments on the phylogenetic relationships of the Laccophilinae (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of the larvae of three species of Laccophilus Leach and comments on the phylogenetic relationships of the Laccophilinae (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution .
Laccophilus paraguensis
inhabits Brazil , Paraguay , Bolivia , and the Argentinean provinces of Buenos Aires, Chaco and Entre Ríos (
Trémouilles 1998
;
Benetti et al. 2003
).

Source of material . Nine specimens of instar I, four of instar II and three of instar III were used for the descriptions. Larvae were collected in association with adults at the following locality: Argentina , Buenos Aires City,
22 -X- 2001
to
2 -IV- 2002
, temporary rain pools 20–30 m long, with clear water, soil bottom and abundant vegetation (mainly grasses), and oval-shaped permanent pond about 30 m in diameter, with marginal aquatic vegetation.

L. paraguensis
, abdominal segment VIII and urogomphi, dorsal aspect. Scale bars = 0.20 mm.

TABLE 1. Measurements and ratios for the larvae of three species of
Laccophilus
. Three specimens of each instar were measured for each species.

TABLE 2. Number and position of secondary setae on the legs of larvae of two species of
Laccophilus
. Numbers between slash marks refer to pro-, meso- and metathoracic leg, respectively. A = anterior, D = dorsal, P = posterior, Pr = proximal, V = ventral, Total = total number of secondary setae on the segment (excluding primary and natatory setae). Three specimens of each instar were measured for each species.
